ผู้สร้าง memecoin ของ Trump ย้ายโทเคนมูลค่า 105 ล้านดอลลาร์ไปยังกระเป๋าเงินใหม่

Trump memecoin creators move $105m of token to new wallets

4d ago//Tim Craig
general
AI

Summary

TH

ทีมสร้างเหรียญ TRUMP memecoin ได้ทำการโอนเหรียญรวมมูลค่า 105 ล้านดอลลาร์ไปยังกระเป๋าเงินใหม่ ซึ่งเป็นการโอนครั้งเดียวที่ใหญ่ที่สุดนับตั้งแต่เหรียญถูกปล่อยออกมา การโอนครั้งนี้ประกอบด้วยการโอน 81 ล้านดอลลาร์ไปยังแพลตฟอร์มครอบครองสินทรัพย์ Fireblocks และโอนอีกเกือบ 24 ล้านดอลลาร์ไปยังกระเป๋าเงินที่ไม่ระบุตัวตน กิจกรรมนี้เกิดขึ้นขณะที่การสอบสวนเกี่ยวกับธุรกรรม crypto ของประธานาธิบดีทรัมป์กำลังเพิ่มขึ้น โดยสมาชิกสภาผู้แทนราษฎรสหรัฐกำลังพยายามผ่านกฎหมาย Clarity Act เหรียญ TRUMP memecoin ได้ลดลง 94% จากมูลค่าสูงสุด โดยยังคงมี 80% ของเหรียญทั้งหมดอยู่ในสถานะสำรองตามกำหนดการปล่อยออกมา

EN

The creators of the TRUMP memecoin executed two significant transfers totaling $105 million worth of tokens to new wallets, marking the largest single movement since the token's launch. The transactions involved sending $81 million to a Fireblocks custody platform and nearly $24 million to an unmarked wallet. This activity comes as scrutiny mounts regarding President Trump's crypto dealings while US lawmakers work on the Clarity Act, a crypto market-structure bill that some Democrats oppose due to concerns about Trump's continued crypto profiteering. The TRUMP memecoin has lost 94% of its value since its peak, with 80% of the total tokens still in reserve following a structured release schedule.

Key Points

  • $105 million worth of TRUMP memecoin tokens moved in largest single transfer since launch
  • Transfers occur as scrutiny of Trump's crypto dealings increases amid Clarity Act legislative efforts
  • TRUMP memecoin has lost 94% of value with 80% of tokens still in reserve following structured release schedule

Article

Trump memecoin tokens move wallets. It's the biggest single transfer since the token launched. It comes as scrutiny of the president’s crypto dealings mounts. A crypto wallet tied to the creators of US President Donald Trump’s memecoin moved $105 million worth of the token to new wallets on Friday. The transactions, executed at 10:04 pm on Friday and 3:06 am on Saturday morning, London time, saw a wallet tagged as “Team allocation” on Arkham Intelligence send $81 million worth of TRUMP to a Fireblocks custody wallet, and almost $24 million to another unmarked wallet. Fireblocks is a crypto custody platform that also sells assets on behalf of its customers. The unmarked wallet has previously sent a test transaction to Coinbase, the crypto exchange. It’s not clear why the tokens were sent to these wallets. The team behind the Trump memecoin did not immediately respond to a request for comment. The transactions come as scrutiny of the president’s crypto dealings mounts , and as US lawmakers work to pass the Clarity Act, a broad crypto market-structure bill. Many Democrats say they can’t support the bill, which stands to give the crypto industry a much-needed boost, because it purportedly allows Trump to continue profiting off crypto. Token unlocks Since its launch just over one year ago, Trump’s memecoin has cratered in value. It’s down a whopping 94% from its all-time high of $73, and has fallen a further 14% over the past week amid a crypto market rout that saw Bitcoin shed 12% and trade at its lowest value since April 2025. The recent activity marks the biggest single transfer of the token since it launched. When the Trump memecoin launched, its developers released only 20% of the total one billion tokens to the market. The remaining 80% was kept by Trump and his collaborators in reserve and is subject to a release schedule over the following two years. The first tranches of tokens — worth around $313 million at the time — were unlocked on April 17, exactly three months after the memecoin’s launch. So far, $2.1 billion worth of TRUMP tokens have been unlocked for trading, according to DefiLlama. It’s not clear what portion of the unlocked tokens the team behind the memecoin have cashed out. Once funds are sent to custody platforms like Fireblocks or crypto exchanges, token movements can no longer be traced. Wallets tied to the Trump memecoin have previously sent $96 million in USDC, the dollar-pegged stablecoin, and $8.5 million in TRUMP to Fireblocks. Trump’s memecoin team On the Trump memecoin’s website, the token’s creators and a firm called CIC Digital LLC are pegged to receive the 800 million reserve tokens. Trump wholly owns CIC Digital, according to his 2024 financial disclosure . CIC Digital jointly owns Fight Fight Fight with another firm called Celebration Cards LLC, which is registered in Wyoming by Andrew Pierce, a corporate paralegal for Wyoming LLC Attorney. Pierce’s firm specialises in setting up anonymous shell companies and asset protection planning, according to its website. Bill Zanker, a Trump confidante who co-authored a book with the president in 2007, is listed as the primary contact for Fight Fight Fight in registration documents. Although Pierce and Zanker appear to be involved with Trump’s memecoin, it’s not clear if they will receive any tokens themselves. Tim Craig is DL News’ Edinburgh-based DeFi Correspondent.
